headline: Fiserv’s Only Bear Is a 26-Year-Old Analyst Who Beat Wall Street
summary: For a large chunk of Wall Street, the fintech’s massive earnings miss was a surprise: Nearly 80% of the analysts covering Fiserv had buy-equivalent ratings as of earlier this week.  At ground-zero of Fiserv’s troubles was Clover, the flagship point-of-sale system that frustrated clients with its superfluous fees.  It was a trouble spot that featured prominently in Ball’s research, which involved extensive conversations with the system’s users.

headline: Shift4 Payments (FOUR) Is Down 7.1% After Fiserv Earnings Miss Triggers Payment Sector Sell-Off – Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: Earlier this week, shares of Shift4 Payments experienced a sharp decline after industry peer Fiserv reported disappointing earnings and reduced its financial outlook, triggering a sector-wide sell-off among payment processors. This drop came despite analysts generally maintaining positive ratings on Shift4, highlighting a disconnect between market sentiment and the company’s solid revenue growth and profitability metrics. We'll examine how investor anxiety over sector-wide earnings pressure...

headline: FI Q3 Deep Dive: Leadership Overhaul and Strategic Reset Drive New Baseline
summary: Financial technology provider Fiserv (NYSE:FI) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales flat year on year at $5.26 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.04 per share was 22.9% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: 3 Financials Stocks We Find Risky
summary: Financial firms serve as the backbone of the economy, providing essential services from lending and investment management to risk management and payment processing. But uncertainty about fiscal and monetary policy has tempered enthusiasm, limiting the industry's gains to 15.1% over the past six months. This return lagged the S&P 500's 23.8% climb.
